alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 2:25PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Putnam and southern Clay Counties through 300 PM EST... At 225 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over George`s Lake, or 11 miles north of Interlachen, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Funnel Clouds, wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, minor flooding due to heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Bostwick, Bardin, George`s Lake, Florahome and Carraway. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
